title: 103_hr778
content: The curr_chunk is a section titled "TREATMENT OF CERTAIN AMOUNTS RECEIVED BY A COOPERATIVE TELEPHONE COMPANY." The curr_chunk discusses the treatment of income received by a cooperative telephone company from nonmember companies for communication services. 50 percent of this income is considered as collected from cooperative members to cover losses and expenses. The curr_chunk amends certain billing and collection service fees for cooperative telephone companies, specifying services performed for nonmember companies. The amendments apply to amounts received after December 31, 1992, with no inference on unrelated business income treatment. The curr_chunk clarifies that the amendments made do not indicate the treatment of billing and collection service fees for certain exempt organizations under the Internal Revenue Code. Additionally, it addresses the treatment of certain investment income of mutual or cooperative telephone companies. The curr_chunk discusses the investment income of mutual or cooperative telephone companies, specifically regarding the unrelated business taxable income. It states that certain income, excluding reserve income, should not exceed 35 percent of the company's total income for tax purposes. The curr_chunk discusses the inclusion of reserve income in gross income for mutual or cooperative telephone companies under section 501(c)(12). Reserve income exceeding 15 percent of total income is subject to taxation, with deductions allowed for directly connected expenses. The curr_chunk discusses the inclusion of reserve income in gross income for mutual or cooperative telephone companies under section 501(c)(12), with amendments applying to amounts received after December 31, 1992.
